intro: Pseudocyclosorus lushuiensis, commonly known as the Lushui fern, is a rare and unique species belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, leathery fronds that are typically dark green with a glossy appearance. Native to the mountainous regions of Yunnan Province in China, this plant thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are clustered on the underside of its leaves, a feature common in many ferns. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
